message.content:
cs.CR, cs.HC, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.CV

The paper discusses a new biometric technique for authentication and deauthentication of users, with a focus on mitigating Lunchtime Attacks. This falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The biometric technique is based on a user's seated posture pattern, which involves human-computer interaction and ergonomics, making it relevant to the sub-category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The paper also discusses the use of sensors to capture posture patterns, which falls under the sub-category of cyber-physical systems (cs.CY). The paper involves data collection and analysis, which is relevant to the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI). Finally, the paper discusses the comparison of the proposed technique with other biometric-based deauthentication techniques, which falls under the sub-category of computer vision and pattern recognition (cs.CV).
